Replies.Reply: Once upon a time, in deep winter, a Queen was admiring the falling snow when she saw a rose blooming in defiance of the cold.
Reaching for it, she pricked her finger and three drops of blood fell.

And because the red seemed so alive against the white, she thought, if only I had a child as white as snow, lips as red as blood, hair as black as a raven's wings and all with the strength of that rose.
Soon after, a daughter was born to the Queen and was named "Snow White."
The next winter was the harshest in memory and Snow White's mother passed away.
A year went by but the King was inconsolable. Taking advantage of his grief, dark forces gathered on the kingdom's borders.
The unholy army was defeated, leaving King Magnus with the spoils of victory.
So struck by her beauty was the King, that he forgot, for the first time, his broken heart.

The spell Ravenna's mother placed on her gave her the ability to steal youth and beauty, and indeed all things good, for her own evil purposes. But for every life there must be a death, for every gain, loss, and under the reign of Ravenna nature turned on itself and people turned on each other.
Lay a hand on her and I'll take your head!
Won't take much courage to split your skull from here.
Don't worry, somebody else will.
Your eyes are dim.
After all the business we've done together?
I'll peddle my wares elsewhere, thank you.
I have it right here in my pocket. If you'll just help me up.
Actually, I seem to have drunk it all.
Perfume?
Royalty. That explains it.
Can't you see I'm having a bath?
Then he's dead -
Then she is certainly dead.
I've been to the Dark Forest enough times to know I'm not going back.
Coin's no good to me if I'm lying dead with crows picking at my eyes.
Why is her life of such value?
I'll determine what concerns me, thank you.
And if I refuse?
Do me the favor. I beg of you.
My wife is none of your concern.
Nothing will bring her back.
Death is everywhere.
It's not something I counted.
Sorrow.
Too bad. You'll need one.
Do exactly as I do.
Exactly as I do.
Pay them no mind.
Sure she is.
What do you intend to do with her?
You want her. Give me what I was promised.
Shut up! -
I said, shut up!
I'll keep my word when the Queen keeps hers.
I WANT HER BACK!
Who are you? What the hell's going on?
Why does the Queen want you dead?
Then what makes you so damn valuable?
Never get involved in the Queen's business and what do I do? Get involved in the Queen's business...
Away from you, love. You're trouble.
The Duke? I've seen sheep with more fight in them.
Just for argument's sake.
How much?
Well,it's a long way, through the forest, and that... that's a dangerous road, I couldn't even consider it for less than thirty gold pieces...
Who are you?
I don't trust you Billy Goat.
I still don't trust you.
We'll stay the night here.
I don't recall a question.
Queen. Mountains. Dark Forest. Here.
You'll go where I take you.
You're rather demanding, and not all that endearing, you know?
An army? The Duke fights? He hides behind walls. I know sheep that have more fight in them.
How much?
Reward? Just for argument's sake?
I'll deliver you to safety m' lady.
my better qualities.
I've seen far stranger things in here.
They'd be foolish to. Few survive.
We passed it a few miles back.
I wouldn't do that if I were you.
A fumee.
You want me to call it by another name?
Stay here.
Sara?...
Am I dreaming?
Sara, I'm so sorry. Forgive me, please forgive me. Give me peace. Sara...
A name you'll not mention again.
Feel its weight. One hand to the other.
Now hold it - business end pointed at me.
Which is your lead foot?
Now stay back. You're too small to attack. You have to parry; use your opponents strength against him. Raise your opposing forearm.
With it you block and deflect an opposing thrust. You'll lose meat but you won't die from it. Wait until I'm close.
Not yet. Watch my hands, not my eyes.
Not yet. Not until you can feel my breath.
Now.
This close. Drive it through me. To the hilt. Now look in my eyes.
Don't pull it out 'til you see my soul.
There's a lot you need to learn lass.
Keep that.
Fumee.
It can't be this easy.
Uh-huh.
Troll!
Run!
I told you to run.
Thank you.
Which are you?
We're fugitives from the Queen.
Where are the men?
I don't know, but keep smiling.
I've had worse jobs. And anyway, she's not that heavy.
What do you mean?
Who is she?
Why didn't you tell me?
Because I'd think it too fell a task?
Here.
I've carried it a long time.
Gristle from a stag's heart.
The stag's the most timid animal in the forest but there's a bone in it's heart that gives it courage in it's hour of need and makes it the bravest in of all God's creatures. It's a protection charm.
Or so they say.
Take it.
It's getting dark.
Aye I know the truth. And that's exactly why she should be as far from me as possible.
Trust me. I'm the last thing she needs.
People have made that mistake before.
Come on!
I led them there. I am to blame.
I will take you to Duke Hammond's.
Come on, Beith! Is this how you treat a friend?
I tried to collect the bounty on their heads. A few times.
But there's always tomorrow.
It is your lucky day, Beith. I've got enough gold to keep you in ale for a year.
It's hidden. Back there, in the woods. A short distance.
Just tell me what I've done wrong?
I saved this girl from the Queen. Out of the goodness of my heart.
People change.
We don't need their help.
That's more than you offered me?!
Those are the Queen's men, Beith, better decide quickly.
You were saying?
Ah, a short cut.
Owww!!!
Legend has it dwarves were created to uncover all the riches hidden on earth. Not just gold and precious stones, but the beauty in people's hearts.
Ask me, they've lost the art if they ever had it. When the Queen seized their mines she stole their treasure but more than that she stole their pride.
Nothing half-wit.
What do you say, we let bygones be bygones?
I'm not sure, Beith. If I had any sense I'd have abandoned her long ago.
What are you talking about?
What?!
How do you know her name?!
Who is this?
What is the Duke's son doing riding with the Queen's men?
Why?
The princess is well protected as you can see.
The man who got her this far your lordship.
You'll have to wait for your voice to break before you give me orders -
Anyone can draw steel, boy. It takes a man to use it.
And I you.
You'd be blind not to.
We'll get her to the castle. Don't worry about that..
Not telling someone how you feel and living with the regret is a lot worse.
Here you are. Where it ends. Dressed Up to pretty.
Like you're asleep; about to wake-up and give me more grief. Am I right?
You deserved better.

She was my wife, princess. That was your question that went unanswered. Sara was her name. When I came back from the wars I carried with me the stench of death and the anger of the lost. I wasn't worth saving. But she did so anyway. I loved her more than anything or anyone. And then I let her out of my sight and she was gone and I became myself again. A self I never cared for. Until you. You remind me of her. Her spirit. Her heart. And now you, too, are gone. You both deserved better. And I'm sorry to have failed you as well.
You will be a Queen in heaven now...
And sit among the angels.
Open the gate.
Keep your money.
Back from the dead and instigating the masses.
Only if you have need of a brutish soldier.
You look fetching in mail.
Kill her!
As for the huntsman...
He returned to the forest where he belonged.
Pick it up, William.
Hurry, William! Hurry!
We found it in the woods.
Of course.
It's dying. It doesn't want to be touched.
Father! The Princess!
It will heal in time.
You possess a rare beauty, my love. In here.
Never lose it. Hold it dear. You will need its strength to one day become Queen.
I'll look after it.
You're so beautiful...
You did?
Why?...
Hello?... What's your name?
The Duke?! He's alive?! He still fights in my father's name?!
William? What about William?!
Rose?...
Rose?...
Yes.
You've never come in before.
I'm afraid of her.
No.
What does she want from me?
Let me go!
She's going to kill me! The Oueen!
Believe me! Her brother tried to cut out my heart.
I swear it.
Him! He's the one! He came at me with a knife!
You can't trust him!
He'll betray you -
He'll kill us both -
Get your hands off me.
Get away.
Get away from me.
She wants us all dead. All of us-
You should know. You're the one hunting me.
Where are you going?
I need to get to the Duke's Castle.
Take me, you'll be rewarded.
You're dead if you return without me. And I'm dead if you leave me.
How much is enough?
A hundred. Deliver me safe to the Duke. I give you my word.
Maybe that's a question you should have asked the queen.
Do we have a deal?
I've given you my word.
I don't trust you either.
You haven't answered me.
Where are we going?
I'm going to the Duke's Castle.
You'll take me to the Duke's castle or I'll go alone.
As soon as you get me out of the forest.
There's a reward that awaits you. There are noblemen there, an army.
How much do you want?
Two hundred gold pieces. Do we have a deal?
Swear it.
Fine.
Do you think... will they follow us?
How far have you travelled into the Dark Forest?
What is it?
A what?
She's not real! Not real! Do you hear me?!
Who is she? The one you bargained for.
What?
Why are you?--
What do you mean?
Why do I need to learn how to kill?
Where are you going?
What is it?
Is this the end of the Dark Forest?
How far to the Duke's castle?
If I had you'd be dead. A "thank you"
We mean you no harm.
Why are they looking at me like that?
She's beautiful.
These women... This place.. It's very peaceful. But it makes me very sad.
That's not why. It's because I've never said the words.
I'm not sure I believe it myself. I never felt like a..

Alone in a dark cell. For years. Fighting to cling to memories. What he looked like. Smelled like. The kind man with the big arms and the wonderful smiles.. To me.. he wasn't The King. He was my father.
What is it?
What is it made of?
Was it hers?
Thank you, huntsman.
She's so beautiful.
What is it?
Run!
We must help them!
Why did you come back?
What did you do to them?
Is there no one you haven't wronged?
Tell them the truth, huntsman.
What are you looking at?
Do you hate the Queen?
My father was King Magnus.
If you accompany us to the Duke's castle you will be paid handsomely.
Your weight in gold. Each of you.
Both of us.
What is this place?
Really?
Thank you so much, sir.
No. For before. For defending me.
There were more of you?
I'm so sorry.
I'd be honored.
I don't mind at all, Gus. I haven't danced in a long, long while.
Do you mind, Gus?
You've taught me to fight, surely I can teach you to dance.
Palms up, head straight, look me in the eyes. And...
Gus, no!
I saw you at the village.
Leave him, huntsman. He's our friend.
You didn't.
We were children, William. You're here now.
Up here it's as if nothing's changed. The world looks beautiful again.
It's strange, but... I feel only sorrow for her.
It takes more than a name. I an not my father, William.
How do I inspire? How do I lead men?
That's not how I remember it.
No...
I remember we were always arguing. And fighting. And...
I remember this trick.
No, my lord.
I have rested long enough.
I am ready to ride by your side, my lord, when you face the Queen in battle.
That is all I thought to do when I escaped. But I have come to learn there is no peace while others suffer. Have you not learned that?
I can vanquish her. Defeat her. I am the only one. She told me so herself.
I have been told that I represent you, that it is my place to inspire you. That is wronct. I am not a Queen, not a leader, not a warrior.
You represent me, who I've become - your hopes,: your courage, your will - inspires me.
I have also been told my place is not to fight but to stay here, safely behind these walls. I will not.
I hold life sacred, even more since I've tasted freedom, but I've lost my fear of death.
If Ravenna comes for me, I will ride to meet her. And if she doesn't, I will ride to meet her.
Alone if I must.
But if you would join me, I will gladly give my life for you. For this land and its people have lost too much.
So the Huntsman fights for something other than himself.
If we are at the portcullis when the sun clears the horizon it will be open.
Then we should ride now. They'll have the portcullis up by the time we arrive.
I gave my word I would stand with them!
It ends today... I have come for YOU!
Ten years you locked me away!
I will... defeat... you... I am the only...
By fairest blood... it is undone!
Why this? Why all of this?
It will be all right...
Backlit in a golden hue. A crown is placed on her head.
My daughter will need your son's friendship more than ever, Duke Hammond. As will I yours.
A hell they'll soon revisit!
You are now free. You have nothing to fear from me.
What is your name, my lady?
Who are you?
Indeed, you will.
What...?
We are here to serve you, your Majesty.
From what hell comes this army?
Where is my son?
I have news of the Princess.
Ravenna has kept her all these years.
We don't know if she survived --
You ventured beyond the walls tonight, disobeying my orders. We are all that's left, William. I cannot afford to lose any more of my men.
And I cannot afford to lose my only heir!
Your grief clouds your judgement, my son.
My duty is to protect the people who come to me for help. I will defend them with my last drop of blood but I will not abandon these walls. I cannot afford to believe in miracles.
Your highness...
We thought you...
You must rest -
There will be no battle, your highness.
The Queen cannot be defeated. She cannot be killed. And therefore there can be no victory.
Is there any other way in? Tunnels? Caves?
But how?
We don't have much time.
My name is Ravenna, sire.
That is kind, child. Especially when it is said that yours is the face of true beauty in this kingdom.
Would you like to be dressed up like this and married one day?
I hope you'll invite me?
I know it is difficult, child. When I was your age I, too, lost my mother.
Yes. A King tore me from her arms, dressed me in lace and stole my innocence.
I can never take your mother's place, but I feel that you and I are bound.
I feel it here.
The bane of Kings.
Sup, my lord.
Now you are mine.
I will destroy you.
As my people were destroyed. As my family was destroyed. As I would have been destroyed.
But when a woman stays young forever - no man can resist her - and the world is hers.
First I will take your life, my lord. Then I will take your throne.
The King has laid down his sword for the night.
Drink!
Welcome, brother.
Mirror, mirror, on the wall Who is the fairest of them all?
So kind of you all to stay over.
To the sword.
Finn!
Lock her away. One never knows when royal blood may be of value.
And what of the Duke?
Lay siege to it.
Then lure him out! Burn every village that supports him. Poison their wells.
I wish to interrogate them myself.
I won't go back.
Finn, do you remember when we were children, begging for scraps like those wretches?
Am I not kinder?
You left your home, your family, the bosom of my protection, to aid my enemies? Why?
Lost everything?
Your son?
Very handsome.
Obviously a debt owed to your wife.
There was a time I would have lost my heart to a face like yours -- and you would have no doubt broken mine.
You would kill your Queen?
You have beauty. And courage. But how strong is your heart?
No. Let him return to the Duke and speak of the generosity of his Queen.
And the expense grows.
old?...
My powers... fade.
Mirror, mirror, on the wall, Who is the fairest of them all?
More beautiful, but --
She won't live to see tomorrow. Who is it?! Give me her name?!
Snow White?
Finn'.'.
I should have killed her as a child. She is my undoing?
How is it an innocent young girl makes a fool of my brother?! Armed only with a nail?! If she'd had a sword she'd have taken the whole castle!
You swore to protect me! Do you not understand what, the girl means to us?!
There is no one I can trust in this place!! There is no loyalty! None!!!!
She's no good to me there, lost. I must have her heart! You have failed me!
Have I not given you all? All.
Don't fail me again, Finn.
I have no powers in the Dark Forest. Bring me someone who knows it well. Someone who can hunt her!
My brother tells me you are a widower, a drunkard and one of few who has ventured into the dark forest.
One of my prisoners has escaped there.
She.
Find her. Bring her to me.
You will be rewarded handsomely.
There may be more than gold in the offing.
That is none of your concern.
You will do this for me, Huntsman.
So you wish to be reunited with your beloved?
My condolences.
You miss her?
What would you give to bring her back?
You know of my powers. Bring me the girl and I will bring back your wife.
I can. Believe me, huntsman.
A life for a life.
Find her.
What did you say?
WHAT DID YOU SAY!
Forgive me, brother.
You will pay. You will pay!!!
You see, child, love always betrays us.
By fairest blood it was done and only by fairest blood can it be undone. You- were the only one who could break the-spell and end my life, and the only one pure enough to save me.
You don't realize how lucky you are, never to know what it is to grow old.
What must I do?! Where is she?! Where have they taken her?! Answer me!
ANSWER ME!!!!
help me...
I don't need a map to see you've failed me, fool, your face is map enough!
Where are they now?
Deserters?
Let them come. Let them break their hearts and skulls on these castle walls and bring my prize to me. You must not harm her. I need her heart -- still warm with blood.
Victory comes!
Come to me.
Let her come to me...ALIVE!
.with a thorn!
I'll show you thorns!
Come! ... Avenge your father, who was too weak to raise his sword.
And every day, every hour led you to this ,moment. It burned inside you. It drove you forward, and here you are..
That's it. Fight. Fight for your land...
Watch them die. You gave them hope and they believed you. You have lead them to their deaths. How foolish your followers.
You were never ready for this princess!
Oh... please!
Ravenna's skin blisters and heals. Ravenna raises her arms and black shards start to cover the walls behind her...
But you are right... it is over. Ravenna's laughter pierces Snow White like a dagger. She feels powerless and lost, spitting blood and exhausted. What else can she do?
I will never stop... I will give this wretched world the Queen it deserves...
A life .for a life.
By fairest blood it is done!

NO! She pulls out the dagger, her face starts to age. Ravenna is aging at an incredible pace. Her body gives way and she slumps to the floor, below the mirror. She looks at the mirror above her, gasping, reaching out, her pale eyes looking for a friend, a miracle... but nothing. The black shards that entombed the room start to shatter and fall to the floor.
See child,... we are bound.
They're coming! The King's men!
I will protect my sister!
So it shall be, Finn.
Yes, my Queen.
Are you alright?
Magic comes at a lofty price.
You look...
Tired.
I have something for what ails you.
Yes, Queen?...
Did I wake you?
Are you always awake when I watch you?
My Queen won't allow it. She wants you all to herself.
Not of me.
It's alright, princess. You will never again be locked in a cell.
Your beating heart.
GUARDS!
She was chased into the dark forest.
Have I not given all to you?!
Indeed, my Queen.
The Queen demands the services of someone to navigate the Dark Forest.
You will be compensated.
Where might I find him.
The Queen demands your presence.
You fought in the west? Against the armies of the five kings?
You must have seen a great deal of death?
Come now, you're being modest. There is a difference between gutting a deer and gutting a man. How many did you kill?
Nor I. But I recall every face. There is no greater delight than battle.
Come now, huntsman, what do you feel when you watch a man die? Delight?
And what of them? At the tip of your sword. What do they feel? I'd enjoy knowing.
The.only difference between you and I is I'-never found a wife to save my soul.
Quick work!
Well done, huntsman. Hand her over.
Why do you care?
Come now huntsman, you did your job well.
You are a drunk and a fool. My Queen has many powers; she can take life or sustain it. But she can't bring your wife back from the dead.
Butcher him! Find her!
This is not finished!
Which of you knows the dark forest?
You. You. You. You.
Load and prepare. You ride for bounty.
I have a bowman. Away.
I said away, damn you!
Kill him.
Wait!
You're quick with a bow.
Why?
Have you traversed the Dark Forest?
Then what use are you?
Replace him.
Run, rats, run. Find her!
Have you seen her?
I captured many girls, but your wife was special.
She fought and then she begged. For her life. Please?!!! You should know she called for you. Your Sara.
She told me. Just before I slit her throat.
Now you can look for her in the other world and beg for her forgiveness.
Sister -- heal me!! --
Sister...
I feel...
it is you, my Queen! Yet another kingdom falls to your glory! Is there no end to your power and beauty?
My Queen, you have defied nature and robbed it of its fairest fruit. But on this day there is one more beautiful than you.
She is the reason your powers wane.
Snow White.

She is also your treasure, Queen. It was wise to have kept her close for the innocence and purity that can destroy can also heal. Hold her heart in your hands and you shall never again need to consume youth. You shall never again weaken or age. Immortality without cost!
"Help me?"...
There is nothing more pathetic than grovelling desperation. You sicken me, my Queen.
Yes, my Queen! Yes!!!!
What shall we do with these?
Help!!!!
Thank you.
I don't know how to repay you?
I am Rose.
All the girls in our village were taken.
You're the king's daughter? Princess?...
I don't know, princess.
What will they do to me?
Go.
Ale given you courage again, huntsman?
Aye, but first you'd have to see straight.
You owe me money from my pocket and money for the girl!
I want my money!
Clear the road.
Her nose is on the large size and her chin's a little weak.
I'll give you two gold pieces.
Four gold pieces and that's my final offer!
Ten gold pieces!
The mountains and fortress provide impenetrable protection, my Queen.
We have just captured two of the rebel leaders. They will be put to the sword.
My Queen, these two were captured leading an ambush of our supply caravan.
Because under your rule we have lost everything. We will not stop until this kingdom is free.
She killed brave Lain with only her palm and pulled a dagger from her chest without blood. She cannot be killed.
There is more.
The princess has escaped the castle!
No-one goes into the Dark Forest.
There's one man. A widower.
In the Inn. Drinking.
Appears he's finished.
You asked for me, father?
The Princess?!!
She lives?!
I'm going after her!.
Then I will go alone.
Then I'll find someone who does.
I will not abandon her a second time.
You need a bowman?
I said do you need a bowman?
I want to ride with you.
You are paying well and I need the coin.
No.
As you said, I'm quick with a bow.
And unlike him, I have two good legs.
No, my lord.
It's me. William.
My name is William. I am Duke Hammond's son.
You look familiar.
I was looking for the princess.
To protect her.
And who are you?
I'm grateful for your help but I will take her from here.
I'm sorry I left you.
If I'd known you were alive I would have come sooner.
It's not my place to give you orders. I misjudged you.
We shared a childhood together, before she was taken away. She hasn't changed. She has that same light inside her. Surely you can see it..
If we can just get her to the castle, the people.. The people will see it. She's our only hope, Huntsman.
I've thought about her constantly. Every time I closed my eyes. I can hardly believe I've found her.
I'm afraid to.
Walk with me.
It will be. When you are Queen.
The people of this kingdom hate Ravenna with their very fiber.
Once people find out you're alive they will rise up in your name.
You are his daughter. And rightful heir.
If I had a choice, I would take you far from here. And keep you safe by my side.
The same way you led me when we were children. I followed you everywhere. Ran when you called. I would have done anything for you.
No?
What trick?
What are you looking at? Help her!
You are dwarves, healers, save her!
Do something!
She died for us! For our cause! We cannot hide behind these walls and watch this land die with her!
My grief makes me see clearly, father.
You must turn back!
Eric.
Touch me and see for yourself.
You weren't there to save me, Eric. I called for you but you never came.
Where were you, Eric? Come to me now.
Snow White turns to see -- A HUGE CREATURE REARING UP --
She stands her ground, fighting her terror, PULLS HER KNIFE.
They say only demons or spirits can survive the dark forest. Which are you?
Neither. Perhaps you are the Queen's spies?
Gone.
You have travelled far Huntsman. With a heavy burden.
You mean... you do not know who she is?
That is not a kind thing to say in these times. Youth one cannot alter... beauty, however. We have sacrificed beauty to raise our children in peace. And you, your sacrifice will come, princess.
You must prepare yourself, my dear. For a time soon comes when you must deliver that sacrifice. Will you be ready?
Sleep my dear. You must rest.
How can you desert her now you know the truth?
She's the only one that can save us. She needs you.
There's good in you Huntsman. I can see it.
You will! Go!
My father showed me how to make them. But he's gone away.
Here. She's finished.
With something from the past. Almost like a ghost. Or a vision.. He nods to her in recognition.
Anna pulls Snow White away, as they move through the smoke and the fire.
Well, well, well... the miscreant huntsman.
No, you horn beast, this is how I treat a friend!
This is my lucky day, the puttock I loathe most in the world lands in my lap.
Tell me what you've done right first?
Doesn't sound like you, huntsman.
Are you?
Hate's a strong word.
But not strong enough in this case.
You were already lost seeing that you found us.
Goodness of your heart, eh, Huntsman?
Alright, we'll take you, but the huntsman can hang -
One dwarf's worth a dozen tallsters, I'll take my time thank you --
Cut him down! MOVE OUT!
set up camp.
Fleecing us of all our rum, eh huntsman?
Not yet, nut-hook. What's in it for you?
I'm talking about the girl? Is it really just the gold?
Muir says she's destined. Question is, huntsman, for whom?
No one's ever seen it before.
What is it, Nion?
Aye, the Queen will flay us alive for helping her!
We'll rest the night at the top of this hill.
What we promised.
It's a miracle!
Hi-Ho boys. Off to work.
The gatehouse is fifty yards away to left.
Come on!
Now let's see how this works! --
Hail to the Queen!
Shut it, you hedge pig.
So what's the verdict?
Destined?...
How handsomely?
There's plenty of moss.
Pests.
Play louder, you whey-face, I can still hear those harpy fairies.
What are you pribbling at, longshanks?!
I'm half of nothing.you canker blossom.

One day the group you see before you went down into the mine for a month long shift. Gus was only a boy. When we came back to the surface... nothing. The land was black, everything, everyone... dead, gone. We searched but...
Just you and me,... do you think there are any of us left? Do you think perhaps they were merely banished?
Well, maybe that's the point, isn't it?
How's your gout?
You don't think it has anything to do with...
So you're saying she is destined?...
I've nothing against the girl, but I'm not willing to risk my life for her either, like poor Gus.
That little mutton?
What do we do?
Shut your ugly mug, huntsman. You had any pennies they would have fallen out your pockets by now.
Pull the other one, you lying dangler.
People, not ruttish swine.
Blasted fairy music. Wish I had some wax to stuff my ears.
I don't trust her. And I don't believe in her, no matter what Muir says.
As long as the Queen's in charge we'll never know.
Queer. Since when?
Better.
How much have you had to drink?!
We need to convene.

This is what happens when dwarves mix with men. We always come out worse. We have big hearts and we'll fight for any cause -- but for what? For some new Queen to call us runts and turn us out of our homes again?
What use is gold if you're dangling by your bony neck, you jackdaw?!
Gus lost his life because of her!
We're promised gold and volunteer for manure. How low has the dwarf race sunk?
Nothing, Miss. It's just... you been the prettiest thing I ever did seen.
She is.
They call it Sanctuary, my lady. The Enchanted Forest. It's the home of the fairies.
Fairies.
I know I'm a bit spongy to look at, Miss, but would you care to dance-with a little 'un?
You don't mind me saying, you got two left feet for a princess.
Replies.Didascalie: (As Snow White treads on his toes)

Replies.Reply: Not at all.
Aye!
Come on!
PRINCESS!
I shan't leave you, Miss.
Quert?
No!
She is destined.
No one listens to me.
Son?... Sing the one.
That seat's not taken, if that's what you were about to ask.
It's only a log, no need to praise me.
Your father was a good man. The kingdom prospered. Our people prospered.
Aye.
That was the month your father died.
As am I, princess. As am I.
It's blessing her.
You have eyes, huntsman, but do not see.
She is life itself. She will heal the land.
No one listens to me.
Can't you feel it? Are you ailments not gone? Gold or no gold, where she leads I follow.
The White Hart blessed the girl.
Even our own legends speak of the redeemer who will heal the land.
All the lions and wolves in the kingdom have tried to defeat the Queen and failed. Why not a mutton?
No. He gave his life for her. As will I if necessary. Look at us. Look at what we've become.
We were once proud, now we pilfer and drink and dream of when we didn't. I am willing to die for a chance at becoming the man I once was.
Leave 'em to rot.
That would work, too, but my way's cleaner.
True, but because of your size you eat and drink more, which costs more, so...
That song takes me back to the battle of Tylweth Gate. A small horde versus an army.
Not sure yet.
That's not how you sharpen an axe. You sharpen downward. Not upward..
Well he taught you wrong.
I like them odds.
Four tops.
Yeah. Or skewer him and leave her to rot!
I get more than you.
Riders!
Them were the days.
What happened to your quailing cough?
Does this mean we're not fighting the Queen?
My father taught me how to sharpen an axe.
You want to test it?
Seven dwarves against an army.
Give us a couple of minutes.
Snow White sees tiny figures flying behind the trees -- almost too fast to spot -- the pollen following them in long trails --
The white hart bows before the princess, father.
What about the gold he promised us?
Times like this I wish I was taller.
A SCREAM fills the air -- not Snow White but dozens of birds shrieking in the sky above --
William blasts with a sword at the screeching birds --
Her lips part ever so slightly, and she lets out an almost inaudible whisper of breath.
Huntsman!
Yes, I recognized you.
We have no quarrel with you. Not anymore.
Eric, in the very back of the cathedral, near the door.
